meanings.definition: The hard outer covering of an egg
meanings.sent1: The bird laid her eggs in a cozy shell.
meanings.sent2: Carefully crack the shell to reveal the egg inside.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken sit on the eggshell? To keep it warm!
meanings.sent4: The fragile shell protected the chick as it grew inside.
meanings.sent5: The colorful shell of the Easter egg caught the sunlight beautifully.

meanings.definition: A projectile fired from a gun
meanings.sent1: The soldier loaded the shell into the cannon.
meanings.sent2: The loud bang indicated the firing of the shell.
meanings.sent3: Why did the clam refuse to share? Because it was feeling a bit shellfish!
meanings.sent4: The artillery shell exploded in a burst of smoke and debris.
meanings.sent5: The shell whistled through the air before hitting its target.

meanings.definition: A container typically used for holding liquids
meanings.sent1: The chef poured the soup into a large shell.
meanings.sent2: The seashell was repurposed as a decorative shell for the bathroom.
meanings.sent3: Why did the snail bring a tiny cup to the party? To have a shell of a time!
meanings.sent4: The shell of the coconut held refreshing coconut water.
meanings.sent5: The glass shell was filled to the brim with lemonade.

meanings.definition: To remove the outer covering of something
meanings.sent1: She used a knife to shell the boiled eggs.
meanings.sent2: The chef demonstrated how to shell a lobster quickly.
meanings.sent3: Why did the squirrel learn to shell nuts? To enjoy the tasty insides!
meanings.sent4: The gardener shelled peas for dinner.
meanings.sent5: He carefully shelled the pistachios to snack on later.

meanings.sent1: The athlete can shell through the obstacle course effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit shelled away from the predator in a flash.
meanings.sent3: Why did the turtle challenge the hare to a race? To show it can shell too!
meanings.sent4: The car shelled down the highway at top speed.
meanings.sent5: The skater shelled across the ice with grace and speed.
